summary: The Helping Young Americans Save for Retirement Act amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA) and the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to lower the minimum age for participation in certain retirement plans to 18. This change allows younger employees to become eligible for participation in 401(k) plans and other retirement savings programs at an earlier age. The bill includes conforming amendments and specifies an application date for the changes.
